dublin_core.dcvalue: This article reports a study that pilot tested the effectiveness of a low technology structured intervention to standardize home healthcare management of patients with heart failure HF within a home health agency HHA The purpose of this study was to use low technology equipment to improve care for patients with HF enrolled in a home health agency The 9 week intervention was targeted toward the home health nurses and included telephone and home visits a teaching tool digital scales and a log notebook filled out by the patients in the study Patient outcomes included decreased rehospitalization decreased symptoms of HF and increased quality of life
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:27:57Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2006-10-02
Low-technology heart failure care in home health: improving patient outcomes.
